Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: ネコ好きのじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Cat Lover

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: <Leader>
Entry.EnglishText: <Leader>

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ネコ好きのじいさんの家
Entry.EnglishText: Cat Lover's House

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン・ネコ好きのじいさんの家
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown ・Cat Lover's House

Entry.JapaneseText: ネコ好きのじいさんの家
Entry.EnglishText: Cat Lover's House

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: <icon:20> 見る
Entry.EnglishText: <icon:20>Look

Entry.JapaneseText: <icon:20> 「ニャーン」と言ってみる
Entry.EnglishText: <icon:20>Say "Meow"

Entry.JapaneseText: <icon:20> 考える
Entry.EnglishText: <icon:20>Consider

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャオーン♪
Entry.EnglishText: Meow♪

Entry.JapaneseText: わしは、ネコ好きのじいさんじゃ！ うーん……ネコちゃーん♪
Entry.EnglishText: I'm a Cat Lover! Ohh... Cats!♪

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの上空がすごい事になっているらしいのぉ…… ラジルダが沈んだ時のように、またしても <Yellow>地形が変わってしまった<White>そうじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like things are pretty intense in the sky over Balka... Just like when Razilda sunk, it looks as though there has been a change in <Yellow>geographical features<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今まで海だったところに、 何かあるかもしれんのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like there may be something in a place that was once ocean...

Entry.JapaneseText: あー、キミたち…… このじじと、少し話をしていかんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, would you be so kind as to listen to an old man for a bit?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: うひゃひゃ。 そうかそうか……
Entry.EnglishText: Ohoho. I see...

Entry.JapaneseText: あのなぁ、キミたち……
Entry.EnglishText: Sooo... Have you ever...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……街の外を歩いていて 「何かを発見しました！」と、 なった事はないかの？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Been walking outside of a town, and thought to yourself "Hey, I've found something!"?

Entry.JapaneseText: それは、すなわち<Red>ディスカバリー<White>と いうやつじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: That would be a <Red>Discovery<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: そもそも、ディスカバリーとは何かと言うと、 <scale:12C>「見つけてうれしい」<scale:100>というものじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: You might also refer to a Discovery as <scale:12C>"Something I'm happy to have found."<scale:100>

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:C8>ふが…… それだけでは不満か？
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:C8>Hm... I take it you're not satisfied with that explanation?

Entry.JapaneseText: では、このじじが、 <scale:12C><Purple>「素晴らしい！ こんなものを発見するなんてステキ！」<White><scale:100>と ほめたたえてしんぜよう！
Entry.EnglishText: Well, when I see them, I tend to exclaim " <scale:12C><Purple>Wow! I am so blessed to have found something like this!<White><scale:100>"

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:C8>ふがふが…… それは全くうれしくないか？
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:C8>Hm hm... Does that not make you happy?

Entry.JapaneseText: ん…… たくさん発見をすると、何か良い事が あるかもしれんのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hm... Well, if you discover a lot of things, then maybe something good will come of it...

Entry.JapaneseText: ディスカバリーは、ワールドマップの 「発見物」という項目に記録される。
Entry.EnglishText: Discoveries are recorded in the Discovery section of the World Map.

Entry.JapaneseText: あるはずの場所に行っても見つからない場合は、 <Red>観察力<White>が足りないのかもしれんのぉ…… まずは、戦って経験をつむ事じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're still unable to find something after going to where it ought to be, then perhaps your Observation Level isn't high enough. You'll have to fight and gain experience first.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red>観察力<Green>は、<Veigue>のＬＶ（レベル）と 同じ値です。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Your <Red>Observation Level<Green> is the same as <Veigue>'s level (LV).

Entry.JapaneseText: それから…… 行く必要がないように思えるような 場所もうろついてみる事じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Once you do that, try exploring out of the way places.

Entry.JapaneseText: ん…… じじの長い話を聞いてくれたお礼じゃ。 キミたちにひとつ称号を贈るとしよう。
Entry.EnglishText: Hm... Thank you for letting me talk your ear off. I'll give you each a Title in return.

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: むーん…… さみしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh... I'm so lonely...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0> 他愛もない世間話をする 割と役に立つ世間話をする 「ディスカバリー」の説明を聞く
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>Make Small Talk Have a Productive Conversation Hear an Explanation on Discoveries

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0> 「発見物」の話をする 「カレギアの大陸名」の話をする 「ディスカバリー」の説明を聞く 「発見物」の情報を聞く
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>Talk about Discoveries Talk about the names of Callegea's Continents Hear an Explanation on Discoveries Hear Information about Discoveries

Entry.JapaneseText: ……んー、じじは…… 「まねきネコ」が欲しいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hmm... I'd like to have a Lucky Cat...

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:C8>……いや、ほんのひとり言じゃよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:C8>Oh... Don't mind me, I'm just talking to myself...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……んー、そういえば…… <scale:180>「まねきネコ」はミナールで 売っているらしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hm, come to think of it, I think they sell Lucky Cats in Minal...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……「まねきネコ」…… 欲しいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hmm... I'd like to have a Lucky Cat...

Entry.JapaneseText: じじに「まねきネコ」を プレゼントしてくれるような <scale:180>気前が良くて優しくて素敵な お方はおらんかのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: If only there were someone so kind and generous as to bestow one upon me...

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:C8>……いや、本当にひとり言じゃよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:C8>Oh... Don't mind me, I'm just talking to myself...

Entry.JapaneseText: おっおっ！ 「まねきネコ」を持っておるな？ 言わずともわかる！ ネコちゃんの気配でわかる！
Entry.EnglishText: Oohh! You have a Lucky Cat, don't you! You don't even have to tell me, I can sense it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>「まねきネコ」をあげますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>Hand over a Lucky Cat?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: うひゃひゃひゃ！ なんと、気前が良くて優しくて 素敵なお方じゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Ohohoho! To think that there was someone so kind and generous...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今後、ディスカバリーの発見数を じじに知らせておくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: Please tell me how many discoveries you have made...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何か役に立てるかもしれんのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: I might be of some assistance to you...

Entry.JapaneseText: むーん…… つれないのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Mmm... You're being awful mean...

Entry.JapaneseText: 発見済みの発見物は<unk17:38440480>か……
Entry.EnglishText: The number of Discoveries you have made is <unk17:38440480>.

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: 「聖なる星」を七つ見つけたようじゃな……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like you've found the seven Sacred Stars...

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: 世界探求の旅は始まったばかりじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: You're journey around the world has only just begun...

Entry.JapaneseText: まだまだ世界は秘密にみちておるぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: There are still many mysteries that this world has to offer...

Entry.JapaneseText: なかなか歩き回っておるようじゃな。 世界には面白いものがたくさんあるぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like you've been getting around. There are many interesting things out there...

Entry.JapaneseText: おお……がんばっておるのぉ。 世界には面白いものがたくさんあるぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: Ohh... You're putting in work. There are a lot of interesting things out there...

Entry.JapaneseText: すごいのぉ…… あと少しじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: You're doing great... Just a little more...

Entry.JapaneseText: たいしたもんじゃ！ この調子で、世界の不思議を 全て発見するのじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: You're doing a great job! If you keep it up, you'll discover all of the wonders of the world...

Entry.JapaneseText: おっおっお！ 世界の不思議を 全て発見したようじゃな！
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, ohh! You've discovered all the world's wonders!

Entry.JapaneseText: たいしたものじゃ！ おぬしたちには ビックリ称号を贈ろう！
Entry.EnglishText: That's great! Allow me to give you these surprise titles!

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: ……カレギアの大陸名の話でもしようか？ これはディスカバリーのヒントにも 関係する話じゃよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You want me to talk about the continents that make up Callegea? I'll also be giving you some hints that will help you make Discoveries.

Entry.JapaneseText: 西大陸は「ウエスタリア」 東大陸は「イースタリア」 南方、バビログラードの近くは「ボーダリア」 北方の島々近辺は「ノースタリア」という名じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: The western continent is Westalia, the eastern continent is Eastalia. The southern area by Babilograd is called Bordalia, and the islands to the north are called Northtalia.

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカのある大きな島は ズバリそのもの「バルカ島」という名じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: And, the island that the capital of Balka is on is called Balka Island.

Entry.JapaneseText: ノースタリアには「動物」 ウエスタリアには「植物」 イースタリアには「自然現象」 ボーダリアには「昆虫」が多いらしい。
Entry.EnglishText: Northalia has lots of animals, Westalia has lots of plants, Eastalia has lots of natural phenomenon, and Bordalia has lots of bugs.

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカ島の発見物は 少々見つかりにくいらしいのぉ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's a little hard trying to discover things on Balka Island, though.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の名前で言うと、 「アニカマル」「ラジルダ」の周辺には 発見物は無いようじゃ。 きっと、発見されつくしたんじゃな。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't seem like there's anything left to be discovered around Anikamal or Razilda.

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの上空がすごい事になっているらしいのぉ…… ラジルダが沈んだ時のように、またしても <Yellow>地形が変わってしまった<White>そうじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like things are pretty intense in the sky over Balka... Just like when Razilda sunk, it looks as though there has been a change in <Yellow>geographical features<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今まで海だったところに、 何かあるかもしれんのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like there may be something in a place that was once ocean...

Entry.JapaneseText: そういえば…… スールズの近くで、かわいい動物が よく見かけられるらしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Come to think of it, I think there are lots of cute animals to be found around Sulz...

Entry.JapaneseText: ケケット街道には 近づく者に砂を投げつけるという 植物が生えているそうじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that there is a plant that grows along the Keketto highway that throws sand at people.

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズの<Yellow>すぐ近くのようで 遠いところ<White>に動物がいるらしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like there is an animal that lives <Yellow>just outside<White> of Sulz...

Entry.JapaneseText: アルヴァン山脈の北には 大きな自然現象があるらしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: There seems to be an impressive natural phenomenon north of the Alvan Mountains...

Entry.JapaneseText: エトレー橋の西には 何かあるらしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like there's something west of the Etoray Bridge...

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナールの近くの橋を渡った 南の平原には何かあるらしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard there might be something in the southern plains. You'll reach it after crossing the bridge near Minal.

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカ島のどこかに トゲトゲな動物がいるらしい……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that there's a spikey animal somewhere on Balka Island.

Entry.JapaneseText: ノースタリアのどこかに 氷に関する自然現象があるらしい……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like there's some ice related natural phenomenon somewhere on Northtalia...

Entry.JapaneseText: イースタリアの東側の海に面したあたりに なんとかの卵というものがあるらしい……
Entry.EnglishText: On the eastern seaboard of Eastalia, there seems to be some type of egg...

Entry.JapaneseText: 珍しい花があるらしい…… 南の方角じゃな……
Entry.EnglishText: There seems to be a rare flower somewhere in the south...

Entry.JapaneseText: 「パンチモンキー」という 動物がいるらしい…… イースタリアをくまなくチェックじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: There appears to be an animal called the Punch Monkey... You should go check around Eastalia...

Entry.JapaneseText: どこかの島に 見える者と見えない者に分かれる 動物がいるらしい。 ホントかのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that there's an island where the animals are divided based on whether they are visible or invisible... I wonder if it's true...

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼンの北には、でかい自然現象が いくつもあるので、その近くにある 小さな動物を<Yellow>見落としてしまう<White>かも しれないのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: There are many impressive natural phenomenon north of Nolzen, but they might cause you to <Yellow>overlook<White> the small animals in the area...

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカ島の中心…… つまり、首都バルカの近くに 「陽の碑」「陰の碑」というものがある。
Entry.EnglishText: In the middle of Balka, there is a Monument to the Sun and a Monument to the Moon.

Entry.JapaneseText: それ自体はすぐに見つかるが、 その碑文が、新たな発見物の 方角を示しているらしい。
Entry.EnglishText: They're easy enough to find, but I've heard the inscriptions on them can lead you to a new Discovery.

Entry.JapaneseText: おぬしたちは、全ての発見物を見つけておる。 情報は不要じゃな……
Entry.EnglishText: You've discovered everything there is to be discovered. I have no more information to give you...

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:12C><Purple>「きゃあ！ 全部発見しちゃうなんてステキぃ！」<White><scale:100>
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:12C><Purple>"You're so cool! You've discovered everything!"<White><scale:100>

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:C8>……ふがふが…… じじに言われても全くうれしくないか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hmm... I take it you're not happy hearing that from an old man?

Entry.JapaneseText: 行く必要がないように思えるような 場所もうろついてみる事じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Try exploring out of the way places.

Entry.JapaneseText: 地鳴りがしておる…… この世の終わりかのぉ……？ まぁ、じじはいつ死んでもいいんじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: This earthquake... I wonder if the world is coming to an end? Well, I guess my time could come at any time...

Entry.JapaneseText: それにしても、揺れのせいで、 絵が描きにくいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Not to mention that all this shaking is making it hard to paint...

Entry.JapaneseText: うーむ、何か…… 外がえらく騒がしいのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmmm...It seems like there's quite a commotion outside...

Entry.JapaneseText: 広場で何かある……？ じじは、絵に集中したいので、 行かないでおくわい……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps there is something going on at the town square? I don't plan on going because I'd rather spend my time painting...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『油絵を描くための道具』 パレットと筆洗。 筆洗から独特のにおいがする。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Tools for Oil Painting - A palette and a brush washer. The brush washer has a peculiar smell to it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『人生を考える場所（別名：トイレ）』 「人生の意味」や「生」と「死」について 少し考えてみた……
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Place Where You Ponder Over Life- - (AKA: The Toilet) - I've reflected a bit about life, death, and the reason we are here...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『あっち向きのペチャ』 ネコの寝姿を描いた絵。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Pecha Looking Outside - It's a painting of a sleeping cat.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『タマちゃん考える』 かわいらしいネコが 小首をかしげて こちらを向いている絵。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Thinking Tama - An adorable portrait of a cat that is tilting its head and looking at the viewer.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『新鮮な野菜』 これはネコではなく じいさんの食事用だろう。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Fresh Vegetables - Cats can't eat vegetables, so they're probably for the old man.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>何を描いているのか、 ちょっと覗いてみた。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>You take a peek at what he's drawing...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>すると、それは ネコの絵ではなく……
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>It's not a cat, but rather...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>姉弟とおぼしき女の子と男の子が 晴れた空の下、広い野原で にっこりと笑っている絵だった。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>It's a painting of a boy and a girl that appear to be siblings smiling in a field beneath a blue sky.

Entry.JapaneseText: ずっと昔に亡くした、 娘と息子じゃよ……
Entry.EnglishText: It's a picture of my son and daughter... I lost them a long time ago...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>ヒト<White>の記憶など、いいかげんなもので、 楽しい事も悲しい事も 時間が流し去ってしまう。
Entry.EnglishText: The <Yellow>Human<White> memory is a fickle thing. Both the happy, and the sad will be washed away by the flow of time.

Entry.JapaneseText: 親しい者、愛した者、 美しい景色、なつかしい思い出…… すべて、記憶の中で薄れてしまい、 いずれは消え去ってしまう。
Entry.EnglishText: Your family, your loved ones, the beautiful scenery, all those memories you hold dear... Eventually they will fade and cease to be.

Entry.JapaneseText: それが、良い事なのか悪い事なのか、 じじにはよくわからんが……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know if this is a good idea or not, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 大切な事は忘れないように、 絵を描き続けておるんじゃよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I make these paintings so that I do not forget what is important to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ありし日の我が子』 姉弟とおぼしき女の子と男の子が 晴れた空の下、広い野原で にっこりと笑っている絵。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Bygone Days - A painting of a boy and a girl that appear to be siblings smiling in a field beneath a blue sky.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ミーちゃんの思い出』 『寝転がるチャータ』 『夕暮れのベル』 いずれも、ネコを描いた油絵。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Memories of My - - Charter Lying Down - - Bell in the Evening - They are all oil paintings of cats.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『おすましチョビ』 ネコを描いた油絵。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Prim Chobi - An oil painting of a cat.

Entry.JapaneseText: ニ……いや、やめておこう……
Entry.EnglishText: Me—... Actually, nevermind...

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャオーン♪
Entry.EnglishText: Meow♪

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャーン♪
Entry.EnglishText: Meow♪

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャオーン♪
Entry.EnglishText: Meow♪

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャーン……
Entry.EnglishText: Meow...

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャオーン♪
Entry.EnglishText: Meow♪

Entry.JapaneseText: いいわね…… たくさん仲間がいて……
Entry.EnglishText: It's nice to have a lot of friends...

Entry.JapaneseText: ニ……いや、やめておこう……
Entry.EnglishText: Me—... Actually, nevermind...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ネコのぬいぐるみ』 かわいいぬいぐるみが置いてある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cat Doll - There's a cute cat doll here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャーン♪
Entry.EnglishText: Meow♪

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ネコのぬいぐるみ』 かわいいぬいぐるみが置いてある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cat Doll - There's a cute cat doll here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ニャーン……
Entry.EnglishText: Meow...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ネコのぬいぐるみ』 かわいいぬいぐるみが置いてある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cat Doll - There's a cute cat doll here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ふふ…… 私ってバカね……
Entry.EnglishText: Haha... I'm such a fool...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ネコ柄のマット』 じいさんネコグッズ コレクションのひとつ。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cat Patterned Mat - One from the old man's cat collection.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『新鮮な魚』 ネコ用か、それとも じいさんの食事用か とにかくたくさん置いてある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Fresh Fish - It might be for the cats, or for the old man... At any rate, there's a lot.
